page.title: 03Housing in Harberton
page.content:
Most of the houses in the village are owner occupied, apart from a small council owned estate and a few houses that are rented out which still belong to the old Estates. Most of the houses are old, stone built, though some have been rendered in recent years and painted in pastel colours. There is a small new development with a few further houses currently being built but little further building is planned for the village.
The majority of the area consists of very small hamlets each centred around a farm. Several of the old cottages and barns have been renovated and modernised by people who wish to live in the country and can afford to do so.
